basics.name: Micah Alex
basics.label: Designer
basics.summary: I am interested in spheres of work revolving around community technology, archives, novel interfaces etc. I prefer to work as a generalist but have some experience with field research, writing, graphic designing and teaching/facilitating. I dabble in code and art, sometimes.

highlights: Provided exemplary customer support by addressing a wide range of queries related to Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems, demonstrating a understanding of user needs and technical proficiency.
Leveraged technical tools such as Jira and Azure ADFS to streamline customer service processes, improving response times and ensuring effective resolution of issues.

highlights: Co-Designed a fellowship model to research and practice different ways of imagining AI-adjacent processes with creative practitioners across Bidar and Channapatna.

work.summary: Design Beku is an organisation aimed at co-designing with Communities for equitable futures
highlights: During 2022, I co-authored grant proposals on themes like digital rights, open-source software, and equitable platforms. I co-designed and co-facilitated a 90+ participant [townhall](https://twitter.com/DesignBeku/status/1305805491126247424?s=20&t=fWFgayBf_gS-tGYtN90eNQ) to collaboratively shape Design Bekuâ€™s organizational charter, and led a Design Baithak to explore [the influence of live-streaming on political narratives](https://khattamicah.xyz/portfolio/presentation/2020-01-01-The-Imposter-Among-Us/).

Additionally, I co-designed a workshop on algorithms and digital privacy for immigrant communities in Delhi and led a volunteer team to create and distribute educational resources during the COVID-19 lockdown.

In collaboration with Enable India, I facilitated the building of a knowledge infrastructure for individuals with disabilities, including organizing workshops for Disability NGO Alliance Coordinators across Karnataka.

work.summary: Janastu is An Open-Tech Open-Knowledge organization focusing on projects aimed at community empowerment and technological innovation.
highlights: I  presented the design of the Milli platform at an [international](https://www.milli.link/iaw2021/#ways-of-seeing--an-archive-annotation-workshop) conference, demonstrating its potential to foster cross-institutional knowledge sharing and engage a variety of audiences in discussions about open, decentralized access to knowledge.
Was a Panel Speaker at [Alternatives and Demands in Network Ruins](https://twitter.com/dcwalk_/status/1381598287082500100?s=20&t=UQoNcd_xPznfUZlNuWoDbA).

In addition to the Milli Project, I contributed to several other initiatives, such as the [Papad Project](https://open.janastu.org/projects/papad), where I designed audio-based features for rural communities to record and share stories.

I contributed to several community-focused initiatives, including media literacy workshops for young women in rural Uttar Pradesh, where I facilitated digital storytelling through reconfigured devices.

I co-wrote proposals for projects in open hardware, software, and localization, and played a pivotal role in managing events like Anthillhacks 2020. My work also involved collaborating with grantmakers and stakeholders on various projects, such as visualizing [migratory routes of pastoralists](https://blog.janastu.org/mapping-migratory-routes-of-pastoralists/) and designing audio-centric platforms for rural knowledge-sharing communities.

I published a few pieces, including on topics like [community-owned Wi-Fi mesh](https://branch.climateaction.tech/issues/issue-4/cows/) networks and [educational initiatives](https://blog.janastu.org/journeys-dreams-and-everything-in-between/) using [Raspberry Pi](https://blog.janastu.org/a-case-for-a-webinar-pi/) technology.

work.summary: LLNaF is an organisation focussed at Alternative Development through Generative Research
highlights: From Nov 2019 to Jan 2022, as a Network Coordinator, I focused on community-centered research, writing, and network-building, culminating in my thesis [*Care-full Collectives and their Care Practices*](https://khattamicah.xyz/portfolio/research/publication/2020-01-01-Carefull-Collectives-and-their-Care-Practices/) (Aug 2020), exploring care networks and collaboration across collectives. I helped develop a [visualisation](https://kumu.io/embed/1586e748a8bc19787d61801a7eda1e00) of a knowledge observatory with over 300 students and 100+ local coordinators, visiting Bidar frequently for interviews and community projects.

I translated [works](https://indiaifa.org/grants-projects/rukhsana-nazeen.html) from Urdu, co-wrote grant proposals, and co-authored publications, including [*Technofutures from Bidar*](https://one.compost.digital/fertile-technofutures-from-bidar/)*,* detailing the setup of a community mesh network to support the local creative economy.
Additionally, I facilitated workshops, co-edited *Untold Bidar*, and co-wrote pieces on agrarian practices, interviewing local farmers, scientists, and creative practitioners.

work.summary: Habba is an organsiation that aims to bring artisanal products from diverse craftsmen to the internet
highlights: I was initially tasked with managing relationships with existing NGO partners and exploring new partnerships, while gaining insights into the organization's learning opportunities. I proactively took on diverse responsibilities, including redesigning the website using Figma to enhance user experience, sourcing handicrafts for the site, and identifying potential partnerships. I contributed to the growth of the Habba brand by helping develop new services like Habba Bowl and Habba Juices, conducting surveys, and drafting plans. Additionally, I played an active role in event planning and office space reimagining, demonstrating my strategic and innovative approach to problem-solving and project development.
Edited manuscripts, academic documents, whitepapers, etc.

projects.name: Lived Experience Knowledge Archive
projects.description: I was part of a design research initiative for a collaborative project between Enable India and Design Beku, aimed at creating a knowledge infrastructure to support individuals with disabilities.
highlights: This included orchestrating workshops with Disability NGO Alliance Coordinators (GSCs) across Karnataka to identify challenges and experiences in disability support. I developed a metadata schema to build a repository of experiences, created a Notion-based website for the database, and integrated it with Enable India's support WhatsApp bot for broader accessibility.
I contributed to mapping existing infrastructures, co-designed the Asset Library and Service Layer for the Open Livelihood Maidan (OLM), and documented the project's processes.

Key deliverables included the Asset Library, GSC Starter-Kit, service design toolkits, and frameworks for asset generation. I also organized the nationwide dissemination of journey maps and experience booklets, and led workshops on participatory research and archival practices.
Additionally, I introduced interview data booklets at a national conference, engaging over 100 disability organizations and promoting the project's knowledge dissemination.

projects.name: Milli Project
projects.description: Collaborated with archivists and Janastu to design and implement Milli, a platform to democratize archival access through W3C Web Annotation Standards, enabling collaborative annotation, discovery, and sharing.
highlights: Led the design and development of Milli, utilizing the W3C Web Annotation Standard to foster a democratic archival platform.
Prioritized features based on user personas and intentions, shaping user flows for annotating archival items, private curation, and optimized search.
Organized collaborative sessions with private, public, and community-based organizations to ensure project goals and alignments.

projects.name: Papad Project
projects.description: Designed Papad, an audio-visual publishing platform tailored for individuals with low literacy, providing access to content through audio and visual means, effectively addressing literacy barriers.
highlights: Conducted user research to identify key design paths, focusing on audio-based recording to align with community needs in rural knowledge-sharing contexts.
Implemented features such as segmented audio, tagging, and storyboarding to enhance usability for low-literacy users.
Led the design process, including compiling feature lists, developing wireframes, and prototyping with PatternFly Design System.
